skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: All 228 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill contains legitimate PDF processing documentation and Python scripts. Findings are caused by markdown code formatting (backticks), PDF annotation syntax misidentified as crypto, and standard file I/O for document processing.

content.value_statement: Manual PDF processing is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides programmatic access to extract text, merge documents, fill forms, and convert files using Python libraries.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents
Merge multiple PDFs into a single file
Fill PDF forms with text annotations
Create PDFs from scratch with ReportLab
limitations: Cannot process encrypted PDFs without passwords
Scanned documents require OCR for text extraction
Complex form layouts may need manual validation
Image quality depends on source PDF resolution

use_cases.title: Extract table data
use_cases.description: Pull structured tables from research papers and reports into spreadsheets for analysis.

use_cases.title: Automate form filling
use_cases.description: Batch process fillable PDF forms by mapping data from JSON configurations.

use_cases.title: Organize case documents
use_cases.description: Merge and split legal documents, extract key text passages, and create standardized reports.

prompt_templates.title: Extract text
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from {filename.pdf} and save it to {output.txt}

prompt_templates.title: Merge documents
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge {file1.pdf}, {file2.pdf}, and {file3.pdf} into a single document named {combined.pdf}

prompt_templates.title: Fill forms
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill the PDF form at {form.pdf} using the field values in {values.json}. Save the result as {filled.pdf}

prompt_templates.title: Extract tables
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all tables from {document.pdf} and save them to an Excel spreadsheet with each table on a separate sheet

output_examples.input: Fill application_form.pdf with data from applicant.json

best_practices: Verify PDF form fields exist before filling by running check_fillable_fields.py
Use validation images to confirm bounding box accuracy for non-fillable forms
Test with a small subset of files before batch processing large document sets
anti_patterns: Processing password-protected PDFs without verifying encryption first
Skipping validation steps when filling non-fillable form annotations
Assuming all scanned PDFs contain extractable text without OCR

faq.question: Can this skill process scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs require OCR. Use pytesseract to convert images to text first.

faq.question: What PDF form types are supported?
faq.answer: Supports text fields, checkboxes, radio groups, and choice fields in fillable PDF forms.

faq.question: How do I fill non-fillable PDF forms?
faq.answer: Convert to images, create fields.json with bounding boxes, then use fill_pdf_form_with_annotations.py.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my annotations not visible in the PDF viewer?
faq.answer: Some viewers require you to show annotations or may need the file to be saved with specific flags.

faq.question: How does this compare to Adobe Acrobat?
faq.answer: This skill provides programmatic control for automation. For one-time manual tasks, Adobe may be simpler.
